actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Rules of Evidence to permit fair and effective prosecution for rape by providing that evidence of an individual's prior sexual conduct is not admissible in any action or proceeding if an issue in such action or proceeding is whether such individual was raped or assaulted with intent to commit rape.
short_title: Privacy Protection for Rape Victims Act

summary.text: Privacy Protection for Rape Victims Act - Amends the Federal Rules of Evidence to prohibit, in cases of alleged rape or assault with intent to commit rape, the introduction of evidence of the victim's prior sexual conduct or reputation. Makes such prohibition inapplicable to evidence of the victim's prior sexual conduct with the alleged assailant.

titles.title: Privacy Protection for Rape Victims Act

A bill to amend the Federal Rules of Evidence to permit fair and effective prosecution for rape by providing that evidence of an individual's prior sexual conduct is not admissible in any action or proceeding if an issue in such action or proceeding is whether such individual was raped or assaulted with intent to commit rape.
